longTitle.p: Restate and amend the law relating to adoption; to make further amendments of the law relating to children; and for connected purposes.

content.p: This section applies whenever a court or adoption agency is coming to a decision relating to the adoption of a child.

content.p: coming to a decision in any proceedings where the orders that might be made by the court include an adoption order (or the revocation of such an order), a placement order

intro.p: This section applies where a person who is habitually resident in the United Kingdom, any of the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man (the British resident)⁠—

content.p: brings, or causes another to bring, a child who is habitually resident outside the United Kingdom, any of the Channel Islands or the Isle of Man into the United Kingdom for the purpose of adoption by the British resident; or

at any time brings, or causes another to bring, into the United Kingdom a child adopted by the British resident under an external adoption effected within the period of twelve months ending with that time.

intro.p: If a person (P) brings, or causes another to bring, a child into the United Kingdom at any time in circumstances where this section applies, P is guilty of an offence if—

content.p: P has not complied with any requirement imposed by virtue of subsection (4); or
any condition required to be met by virtue of subsection (5) is not met,

wrapUp.p: before that time, or before any later time which may be prescribed.

section.heading: Declaration of special restrictions on adoptions from abroad

content.p: This section applies if the Department has reason to believe that, because of practices taking place in a country or territory outside the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man, (the other country) in connection with the adoption of children, it would be contrary to public policy to further the bringing of children into the United Kingdom in the cases mentioned in subsection (2).
A country or territory in relation to which such a declaration has effect for the time being is referred to in this section as a restricted country.
The Department must publish reasons for making the declaration in relation to each restricted country.
The Department must publish a list of restricted countries (the restricted list) and keep the list up to date.
The reasons and the restricted list are to be published in whatever way the Department thinks appropriate for bringing them to the attention of adoption agencies and members of the public.

In this section, British resident means a person who is habitually resident in the United Kingdom, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man, and the reference to adoption by a British resident includes adoption by a British resident and another person.
